Html:
Hi!

I use the tsc on both Node/V8 and JScript9. The V8 version is that what npm install typescript installs and the JScript9 version is extracted from the Visual Studio installer for TypeScript 0.9.0.1 (namely tsc.exe and tschost.dll) .

The compilation takes ~2.1 secs (0.9.1) and ~3.7 secs (0.9.0.1) with the V8 and JScript9 versions on my machine for the simple HttpServer example from the TypeScript source distribution.

That is a nice improvement for me. I hope the performance improves even more with newer releases, maybe with a smarter compiler, a faster JavaScript engine (I use the tschost.dll from TypeScript 0.9.0.1; not sure if there were improvements) or incremential compilation for the command line (never used the Visual Studio version).
$ time /d/programme/typescript-0.9.0.1/tsc.exe HttpServer.ts --module commonjs
real    0m2.140s
user    0m0.000s
sys     0m0.015s

$ time /d/programme/typescript-0.9.1/tsc.exe HttpServer.ts --module commonjs
real    0m3.765s
user    0m0.015s
sys     0m0.000s
